gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry
Class Position3D

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry.Position3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
IXmlIO, java.io.Serializable
public class Position3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, IXmlIO

Position3D represents a position in 3D space in cartesian, cylindrical and spherical coordinate systems. Methods are provided to get & set the position in all three of these coordinate systems. All angle parameters are specified and returned in radians.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setCartesianCoords

public void setCartesianCoords(float x,
                               float y,
                               float z)
Specify the position as a triple of values, (x, y, z) in Cartesian coordinates.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate.
y - The y-coordinate.
z - The z-coordinate.

getCartesianCoords

public float[] getCartesianCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (x, y, z) in Cartesian coordinates.

Returns:
Returns the x, y, z values for the point in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of floats.

setSphericalCoords

public void setSphericalCoords(float sph_radius,
                               float azimuth_angle,
                               float polar_angle)
Specify the position as a triple of values, (r, theta, phi) in spherical polar coordinates. Angles must be specified in radians.

Parameters:
sph_radius - The radius in spherical coordinates.
azimuth_angle - The azimuthal angle in radians.
polar_angle - The polar angle in radians.

getSphericalCoords

public float[] getSphericalCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (r, theta, phi) in spherical polar coordinates. Angles are specified in radians.

Returns:
Returns the values of the radius, azimuth angle and polar angle in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of floats.

setCylindricalCoords

public void setCylindricalCoords(float cyl_radius,
                                 float azimuth_angle,
                                 float z)
Specify the position as a triple of values, (r, theta, z) in cylindrical coordinates. The azimuth angle must be specified in radians.

Parameters:
cyl_radius - The clindrical coordinate "r".
azimuth_angle - The cylindrical coordinate theta, in radians.
z - The cylindrical coordinate z.

getCylindricalCoords

public float[] getCylindricalCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (r, theta, z) in cylindrical coordinates. The azimuth angle is specified in radians.

Returns:
Returns the values of the radius, azimuth angle and z value in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of floats.

getDistance

public float getDistance()
Get the distance of the position from the origin.

Returns:
the distance from this position to the origin.

distance

public float distance(Position3D pos)
Determine the distance between this and another Position3D.

Parameters:
pos - The other Position3D object
Returns:
The straight line distance between the current Position3D and the other specified Position3D object.

getCenterOfMass

public static Position3D getCenterOfMass(Position3D[] points,
                                         float[] weights)
Calculate the weighted average of a list of 3D points, given a list of weights for the points. Any points for which a weight is not given will be given weight 0.

Parameters:
points - Array of Position3D objects whose weighted average is calculated
weights - Array of floats giving the weights of the points.
Returns:
A point containing the weighted average of the specified points.

PrintPoint

public void PrintPoint(java.lang.String title)
Print the position in Cartesian, Cylindrical and Sphereical coords for debugging purposes.

Parameters:
title - A String title to place before the values printed for this position.

XMLwrite

public boolean XMLwrite(java.io.OutputStream stream,
                        int mode)
Implements the IXmlIO interface so a DetectoPositon can write itself

Specified by:
XMLwrite in interface IXmlIO
Parameters:
stream - the OutputStream to which the data is written
mode - either IXmlIO.BASE64 or IXmlOP.NORMAL. This indicates how a Data's xvals, yvals and errors are written
Returns:
true if successful otherwise false

NOTE: This routine writes all of the begin and end tags. These tag names are NOT TabulatedData but either HistogramTable or FunctionTable

XMLread

public boolean XMLread(java.io.InputStream stream)
Implements the IXmlIO interface so a Detector Position can read itself

Specified by:
XMLread in interface IXmlIO
Parameters:
stream - the InStream to which the data is written
Returns:
true if successful otherwise false

NOTE: This routine assumes the begin tag has been completely read. It reads the end tag. The tag names are NOT TabulatedData but either HistogramTable or FunctionTable
